div.div:
docs: fix module readme CREATED & SINCE attrs
Some were missing PR references, others had incorrect values for SINCE and CREATED attributes. Also corrects the capitalization in some SUBTITLEs.

docs: delete old org files
These will be replaced soon (or in modules.org case, they already have, in 2636fbc).
Ref: 2636fbc36f54

docs: move modules.org to modules/README.org
And regenerate the module list using 'doom make-index $EMACSIR/modules'.

dev: add 'doom make' commands
Primarily for regenerating boilerplate in module documentation (such as the top navigation and #+SETUPFILE lines), the module index, and, later, changelog and init.el generators.

docs: add doom-docs-mode & doom-docs-org-mode
These two modes exist to provide a nicer reading experience while viewing Doom's org documentation from within Emacs; they hide meta-lines, comments, markup, and more.
They also enable our docs to use IDs for links and keep our ID db separate from any user ID dbs.
docs(:ui): update READMEs to new format
docs(:tools): update READMEs to new format
docs(:term): update READMEs to new format
docs(:os): update READMEs to new format
docs(:lang): update READMEs to new format
docs(:input): update READMEs to new format
docs(:email): update READMEs to new format
docs(:emacs): update READMEs to new format
docs(:editor): update READMEs to new format
docs(:config): update READMEs to new format
docs(:completion): update READMEs to new format
docs(:checkers): update READMEs to new format
docs(:app): update READMEs to new format

refactor(file-templates): doom readme templates
Including readme template for categories.

tweak(default): consult-flymake in a branch of +default-diagnostics
when available instead of plain flymake-show-diagnostics-buffer
docs(sh): add doctor check for shfmt

bump: :lang lua
https://git.sr.ht/~technomancy/fennel-mode@50ef3c6246f3 -> https://git.sr.ht/~technomancy/fennel-mode@566435734946
A fix was added upstream to fix `fennel-repl` no longer returning the repl buffer. This fixes `+eval-open-repl` in fennel-mode.

bump: :tools tree-sitter
emacs-tree-sitter/elisp-tree-sitter@3cfab8a0e945 -> emacs-tree-sitter/elisp-tree-sitter@c3fe96a103a7 meain/evil-textobj-tree-sitter@0bf5bbbfecba -> meain/evil-textobj-tree-sitter@9dce8dab68c9
This *should* fix issues with pulling down parsers for M1 macs

docs(tree-sitter): remove mention of keys mode
This is no longer in the module
also change highlighting link

fix(python): conflicting pyimport-remove-unused keybind
Binding for `pyimport-remove-unused` clashes with `py-isort-region`

fix(pass): enable evil-collection bindings
- Pass was launched in emacs-state because evil-collection didn't support pass when the module was written, but it does now. - It also removes stale code relative to the PASSWORD_STORE_DIR environment variable, since the password store path is not hardcoded in pass.el anymore.

fix: strip './' from projectile file list produced by fd
Fix: #6504 Ref: bbatsov/projectile#1784
feat(dart): add & improve keybinds for flutter

bump: :completion vertico
minad/consult@b15c81f7766a -> minad/consult@6319aec3513c minad/marginalia@26f2bd9ee7b6 -> minad/marginalia@69442c2d9472 minad/vertico@e5935b5bbfc0 -> minad/vertico@2ad46196653b oantolin/embark@97270d725761 -> oantolin/embark@5d0459d27aa7 oantolin/orderless@75eeae21971d -> oantolin/orderless@8b9af2796fa0

bump: :lang scala
scala/lsp-metals@b7f77de69431 -> scala/lsp-metals@097d6021a4ff
Ref: emacs-lsp/lsp-metals#73

fix(mu4e): support mu 1.8
Thanks to some combination of ignorance and obstinance, mu4e has thrown compatibility to the wind and completely ignored the exitance of define-obsolete-function-alias. Coupled with the inconsistent/partial function renaming, this has made the mu4e 1.6⟶1.8 change particularly annoying to deal with.
By suffering the pain of doing the mu4e author's work for them, we can use defalias to give backwards compatibility a good shot for about 60 functions. Some mu4e~x functions are now mu4e--x, others are unchanged, and then you've got a few odd changes like mu4e~proc -> mu4e--server and mu4e-search-rerun. The form of message :from entries has also changed, and a new (mu4e) entrypoint added supplanting mu4e~start.
Fix: #6511 Close: #6549 Co-authored-by: Rahguzar <aikrahguzar@gmail.com>

fix(cli): __DOOMPIPE+=0: not found errors
The string append operator is a bashism, and therefore is not POSIX complaint. It will throw errors when /bin/sh isn't symlinked to bash.

fix(evil): evil-collection-occur -> evil-collection-replace
evil-collection-occur.el was moved to evil-collection-replace.el in emacs-evil/evil-collection@79fc09b01403.
Fix: #6495 Close: #6524 Ref: emacs-evil/evil-collection@79fc09b01403 Co-authored-by: DeesonGao <DeesonGao@users.noreply.github.com>

fix(cli): validation for regexp arguments
string-match-p throws an error if given an invalid regexp, which is what we *should* be testing for, not its return value (which should be ignored), but this wasn't the case before this commit.
Fix: #6534

bump: :tools lsp
emacs-lsp/lsp-mode@6b6afc00deec -> emacs-lsp/lsp-mode@3fa645c0397b joaotavora/eglot@e835996e1661 -> joaotavora/eglot@bd970be047ab
- There are multiple issues in the lsp-mode repo (emacs-lsp/lsp-mode#2722), lsp-julia repo (gdkrmr/lsp-julia#23 and gdkrmr/lsp-julia#35), and the LanguageServer.jl repo (julia-vscode/LanguageServer.jl#844) about crashes of the Julia LSP with lsp-mode due to errors caused by the folding capabilities announced by the client. One can work around these issues by enabling folding (see gdkrmr/lsp-julia#23) but that is only a hack and does not fix the underlying issue. The problem is caused by a violation of the LSP specs in lsp-mode which was fixed in emacs-lsp/lsp-mode#3593. The PR updates lsp-mode to the latest commit on the master branch which contains this fix (and some other unrelated fixes, CI passes successfully again), and hence the workaround for lsp-julia can be removed.
Ref: emacs-lsp/lsp-mode#3593 Ref: emacs-lsp/lsp-mode#2722 Ref: gdkrmr/lsp-julia#35 Ref: gdkrmr/lsp-julia#23 Ref: julia-vscode/LanguageServer.jl#844 Close: #6516 Co-authored-by: devmotion <devmotion@users.noreply.github.com>

fix(rss): *rss* workspace doesn't exist error
Co-authored-by: Johnson Liu <buyandrep@gmail.com>

fix(cli): display global options in --help output
Global options were omitted in help output for subcommands before this fix. This caused #6533, where the user was unable to find the correct option to suppress prompts because 'doom upgrade --help' would not show --force/-!, but 'doom --help' would. Still, it's unreasonable to expect the user to know this beforehand.
Ref: #6533

fix(cli): void-function always
`always` was added in Emacs 28 and is unavailable to 27.x users, which is unacceptable while Doom supports 27.x.
Fix: #6532 Amend: 74cc541597bd

tweak(default): consult-flymake in a branch of +default-diagnostics
when available instead of plain flymake-show-diagnostics-buffer
docs(sh): add doctor check for shfmt

bump: :lang lua
https://git.sr.ht/~technomancy/fennel-mode@50ef3c6246f3 -> https://git.sr.ht/~technomancy/fennel-mode@566435734946
A fix was added upstream to fix `fennel-repl` no longer returning the repl buffer. This fixes `+eval-open-repl` in fennel-mode.

bump: :tools tree-sitter
emacs-tree-sitter/elisp-tree-sitter@3cfab8a0e945 -> emacs-tree-sitter/elisp-tree-sitter@c3fe96a103a7 meain/evil-textobj-tree-sitter@0bf5bbbfecba -> meain/evil-textobj-tree-sitter@9dce8dab68c9
This *should* fix issues with pulling down parsers for M1 macs

docs(tree-sitter): remove mention of keys mode
This is no longer in the module
also change highlighting link

fix(python): conflicting pyimport-remove-unused keybind
Binding for `pyimport-remove-unused` clashes with `py-isort-region`

fix(pass): enable evil-collection bindings
- Pass was launched in emacs-state because evil-collection didn't support pass when the module was written, but it does now. - It also removes stale code relative to the PASSWORD_STORE_DIR environment variable, since the password store path is not hardcoded in pass.el anymore.

fix: strip './' from projectile file list produced by fd
Fix: #6504 Ref: bbatsov/projectile#1784
feat(dart): add & improve keybinds for flutter

bump: :completion vertico
minad/consult@b15c81f7766a -> minad/consult@6319aec3513c minad/marginalia@26f2bd9ee7b6 -> minad/marginalia@69442c2d9472 minad/vertico@e5935b5bbfc0 -> minad/vertico@2ad46196653b oantolin/embark@97270d725761 -> oantolin/embark@5d0459d27aa7 oantolin/orderless@75eeae21971d -> oantolin/orderless@8b9af2796fa0

bump: :lang scala
scala/lsp-metals@b7f77de69431 -> scala/lsp-metals@097d6021a4ff
Ref: emacs-lsp/lsp-metals#73

fix(mu4e): support mu 1.8
Thanks to some combination of ignorance and obstinance, mu4e has thrown compatibility to the wind and completely ignored the exitance of define-obsolete-function-alias. Coupled with the inconsistent/partial function renaming, this has made the mu4e 1.6⟶1.8 change particularly annoying to deal with.
By suffering the pain of doing the mu4e author's work for them, we can use defalias to give backwards compatibility a good shot for about 60 functions. Some mu4e~x functions are now mu4e--x, others are unchanged, and then you've got a few odd changes like mu4e~proc -> mu4e--server and mu4e-search-rerun. The form of message :from entries has also changed, and a new (mu4e) entrypoint added supplanting mu4e~start.
Fix: #6511 Close: #6549 Co-authored-by: Rahguzar <aikrahguzar@gmail.com>

fix(cli): __DOOMPIPE+=0: not found errors
The string append operator is a bashism, and therefore is not POSIX complaint. It will throw errors when /bin/sh isn't symlinked to bash.

fix(evil): evil-collection-occur -> evil-collection-replace
evil-collection-occur.el was moved to evil-collection-replace.el in emacs-evil/evil-collection@79fc09b01403.
Fix: #6495 Close: #6524 Ref: emacs-evil/evil-collection@79fc09b01403 Co-authored-by: DeesonGao <DeesonGao@users.noreply.github.com>

fix(cli): validation for regexp arguments
string-match-p throws an error if given an invalid regexp, which is what we *should* be testing for, not its return value (which should be ignored), but this wasn't the case before this commit.
Fix: #6534

bump: :tools lsp
emacs-lsp/lsp-mode@6b6afc00deec -> emacs-lsp/lsp-mode@3fa645c0397b joaotavora/eglot@e835996e1661 -> joaotavora/eglot@bd970be047ab
- There are multiple issues in the lsp-mode repo (emacs-lsp/lsp-mode#2722), lsp-julia repo (gdkrmr/lsp-julia#23 and gdkrmr/lsp-julia#35), and the LanguageServer.jl repo (julia-vscode/LanguageServer.jl#844) about crashes of the Julia LSP with lsp-mode due to errors caused by the folding capabilities announced by the client. One can work around these issues by enabling folding (see gdkrmr/lsp-julia#23) but that is only a hack and does not fix the underlying issue. The problem is caused by a violation of the LSP specs in lsp-mode which was fixed in emacs-lsp/lsp-mode#3593. The PR updates lsp-mode to the latest commit on the master branch which contains this fix (and some other unrelated fixes, CI passes successfully again), and hence the workaround for lsp-julia can be removed.
Ref: emacs-lsp/lsp-mode#3593 Ref: emacs-lsp/lsp-mode#2722 Ref: gdkrmr/lsp-julia#35 Ref: gdkrmr/lsp-julia#23 Ref: julia-vscode/LanguageServer.jl#844 Close: #6516 Co-authored-by: devmotion <devmotion@users.noreply.github.com>

fix(rss): *rss* workspace doesn't exist error
Co-authored-by: Johnson Liu <buyandrep@gmail.com>

fix(cli): display global options in --help output
Global options were omitted in help output for subcommands before this fix. This caused #6533, where the user was unable to find the correct option to suppress prompts because 'doom upgrade --help' would not show --force/-!, but 'doom --help' would. Still, it's unreasonable to expect the user to know this beforehand.
Ref: #6533

fix(cli): void-function always
`always` was added in Emacs 28 and is unavailable to 27.x users, which is unacceptable while Doom supports 27.x.
Fix: #6532 Amend: 74cc541597bd
Commented on #8 [REQUEST] Adding more flexibility to pomm using the third time technique.
Super cool. Try first org-pomodoro-third-time to get used it to the workflow. The author did an awesome job with the package. Maybe you could steal it some ideas/code for pomm . Best.
Opened #8 [REQUEST] Adding more flexibility to pomm using the third time technique.

feat(ess): add ess-r-insert-obj package
Utilities to help inserting variable (column) names or values in ESS.

feat(ess): add ess-smart-equals packages
This package auto-inserts assignation operators (`<-`, `<<-` or `=`) after pressing `=`.
feat(ess): add lsp-mode client for TRAMP projects

feat(ess): add popup rules for ESS buffers
This a first try. We can tweak them if there are better choices for each rule.
